title: Shop Manager - Your Ultimate Minecraft Trading Hub
description: Transform your Minecraft trading experience with a powerful Shop Manager! Track your competitors, maximize profits, and never miss a great deal again. Whether you're running multiple shops across different servers or just want to find the best prices, this feature puts you in control of your trading empire.

features.name: üè™ Manage multiple shops across different Minecraft servers
üìä Compare prices instantly - see who's offering the best deals
üéØ Smart filtering by Minecraft version - only see relevant items
üì¶ Stock status tracking - mark when chests are full or empty
üîç Market overview - spot profitable opportunities at a glance
‚ö° Quick price updates - keep your shop competitive in seconds
üèÜ Competitor tracking - monitor what other successful shops are doing
üéÆ Multi-server support - manage shops on Hypixel, your SMP, and more
üì± Easy-to-use interface - no spreadsheets needed!
üéØ Advanced search and filtering - find exactly what you need
üìã Bulk operations - update hundreds of prices at once

title: Version-Aware Pricing and Recipe Integration
description: Currently, the price guide shows the same static prices for all Minecraft versions, but prices can vary between versions as well as recipes. One good example is how the 1.18 world generation update affected the rarity of basic items and therefore their prices. This update addresses two key issues: Allowing different prices for each Minecraft version, and integrating crafting recipes for items so that price adjustments can be calculated and applied to the whole price guide. This feature is currently being developed and tested.

features.name: Version-specific pricing - different prices for each Minecraft version where items or recipes differ
Recipe-based price calculations - crafted items can have their prices calculated from ingredient costs
Recipe database integration - import and manage crafting recipes for accurate cost calculations
Cascading price updates - when base material prices change, all dependent items update accordingly
Improved price accuracy - prices reflect actual crafting costs rather than estimates
Version inheritance - recipes carry forward from earlier versions unless specifically changed
Static price override - ability to set fixed prices for items where market prices differ from crafting costs
Price calculation transparency - show how prices are determined (static vs dynamic)
Import all item recipes

title: Custom Price Guides - Create Your Own Price References
description: Create your own price guides with custom prices and notes. Set prices for any item from the main guide, add personal notes, and choose between static or recipe-based pricing. Perfect for documenting server-specific prices or building your own price reference.

features.name: üìù Create multiple price guides - name them and optionally link to servers
üí∞ Set custom prices for any item from the main guide
üìù Add personal notes to document your pricing decisions
üîß Choose static or recipe-based pricing for each item
‚ö° Bulk import items and recalculate recipe-based prices

title: Profile Switcher / Server Profiles
description: Allow users to save and quickly switch between different sets of price guide settings (version, currency, price ratios, etc.) for different servers or shop contexts. This is especially useful for users who manage shops on multiple servers with different economies.

features.name: Save multiple named profiles with version, currency, and price settings
Quickly switch between profiles from the main price guide UI
Profile management: create, rename, delete, and reorder profiles
Profiles can be linked to specific servers or shop types (optional)

title: Diamond Currency Support
description: Support diamond-based economies as an alternative to money. Users can switch between money and diamond currencies, set conversion ratios, and see prices displayed in their preferred currency. This feature will make the price guide more flexible for servers that use diamonds as currency.

features.name: Switch between money and diamond currencies in the UI
Set and adjust diamond-to-money conversion ratios
Display all prices in the selected currency

title: Add all 1.21 items and recipes
description: Add all new items introduced in Minecraft 1.21 (Tricky Trials Update) including tuff blocks, resin blocks, copper variants, pale oak wood set, trial chambers items, and other miscellaneous items, along with their crafting recipes. This is around 150 items.

features.name: Pale oak wood set - Complete wood type with logs, planks, stairs, slabs, doors, signs, boats, fences, and all variants (19 items)
New block types - Tuff blocks and variants, resin blocks and variants, chiseled copper variants, and copper bulb variants (36 items)
Copper building blocks - Doors, trapdoors, and grates in all oxidation states and waxed variants (24 items)
Trial chambers content - Trial keys, ominous trial keys, ominous bottles, and heavy cores (4 items)
New items and tools - Mace, wind charge, wolf armor, armadillo scute, breeze rod, creaking heart, dried ghast, and other new items (8 items)
Bundle and harness variants - All 16 colors of bundles and harnesses (33 items)
Decorative and utility items - Banner patterns, music discs, smithing templates, plants, and eggs (25 items)
